paper.title: 2024年6月英语六级听力真题（第二套）

options.text: Read numerous comments users put online.
Blended all his food without using a machine.
Searched for the state-of-the-art models of blenders
Did thorough research on the price of kitchen appliances
Eating any blended food.
Buying a blender herself.
Using machines to do her cooking.
Making soups and juices for herself.
Cooking every meal creatively in the kitchen
Paying due attention to his personal hygiene.
Eating breakfast punctually every morning.
Making his own fresh fruit juice regularly
One-tenth of it is sugar
It looks healthy and attractive.
One's fancy may be tickled by it.
It contains an assortment of nutrients.
How he has made himself popular as the mayor of Berkton
How the residents will turn Berkton into a tourist attraction.
How charming he himself considers the village of Berkton to be.
How he has led people of Berkton to change the village radically.
It was developed only to a limited extent
It was totally isolated as a sleepy village.
It was relatively unknown to the outside
It was endowed with rare natural resources.
The people in Berkton were in a harmonious atmosphere
The majority of residents lived in harmony with their neighbors
The majority of residents enjoyed cosy housing conditions
All the houses in Berkton looked aesthetically similar.
They have helped boost the local economy.
They have made the residents unusually proud.
They have contributed considerably to its popularity.
They have brought happiness to everyone in the village.
They have created the smallest remote-controlled walking robot in the world.
They are going to publish their research findings in the journal Science Robotics.
They are the first to build a robot that can bend, crawl, walk, turn and even jump.
They are engaged in research on a remote-controlled robot which uses special power.
It changes its shape by complex hardware
It is operated by a special type of tiny motor
It moves from one place to another by memory
It is powered by the elastic property of its body.
Replace humans in exploratory tasks
Perform tasks in tightly confined spaces.
Explore the structure of clogged arteries.
Assist surgeons in highly complex surgery
She threw up in the bathroom.
She slept during the entire ride.
She dozed off for a few minutes.
She boasted of her marathon race.
They are mostly immune to cognitive impairment.
They can sleep soundly during a rough ride at sea.
They are genetically determined to need less sleep
They constitute about 13 percent of the population.
Whether there is a way to reach elite status.
Whether it is possible to modify one's genes.
Whether having a baby impacts one's passion.
Whether one can train themselves to sleep less.
It is in fact quite possible to nurture a passion for sleep.
Babies can severely disrupt their parents' sleep patterns
Being forced to rise early differs from being an early bird.
New parents are forced to jump out of bed at the crack of dawn
We have poor awareness of how many controversial issues are being debated.
No one knows better than yourself what you are thinking about at the moment.
No one can change your opinions more than those who speak in a convincing tone.
We are likely to underestimate how much we can be swayed by a convincing article.
Their belief about physical punishment changed
Their memory pushed them toward a current belief.
The memory of their initial belief came back to them.
Their experiences of physical punishment haunted them
They apparently have little to do with moderate beliefs
They don't reflect the changes of view on physical punishment
They may not apply to changes to extreme or deeply held beliefs.
They are unlikely to alter people's position without more evidence
American moms have been increasingly inclined to live alone.
The American population has been on the rise in the past 25 years
American motherhood has actually been on the decline.
The fertility rates in America have in fact been falling sharply.
More new mothers tend to take greater care of their children
More new mothers are economically able to raise children.
A larger proportion of women take pride in their children.
A larger proportion of women really enjoy motherhood.
The meaning of motherhood has changed considerably.
More and more mothers go shopping to treat themselves.
More mothers have adult children celebrating the holiday.
The number of American mothers has been growing steadily
Add to indoor toxic pollutants.
Beautify the home environment.
Absorb poisonous chemicals.
Soak up surrounding moisture.
NASA did experiments in sealed containers resembling the super-insulated offices of 1970s.
It was based on experiments under conditions unlike those in most homes or offices.
NASA conducted tests in outer space whose environment is different from ours
It drew its conclusion without any contrastive data from other experiments.
Natural ventilation proves much more efficient for cleaning the air than house plants
Houseplants disperse chemical compounds more quickly with people moving around.
Natural ventilation turns out to be most effective with doors and windows wide open
Houseplants in a normal environment rarely have any adverse impact on the air.
The root cause for misinterpretations of scientific findings
The difficulty in understanding what's actually happening.
The steps to be taken in arriving at any conclusion with certainty.
The necessity of continually re-examining and challenging findings.
